exercises.setup_notes: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
exercises.execution_notes: Bend and extend the elbows while keeping the arms overhead. Ensure the cable provides tension throughout the range of motion.
exercises.tier_reasons: Provides high tension in the stretched position, feels good, and allows for simple progression. Validated by a 2023 study showing 40% more triceps growth than press downs.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Long head, due to the overhead position providing a deep stretch.
exercises.scientific_insights: 2023 study found overhead extensions caused about 40% more triceps growth than press downs.
exercises.selection_reason: This exercise is selected as it's an S-Tier exercise according to the provided data, focusing on the long head of the triceps which is crucial for overall triceps development.  The overhead position ensures a deep stretch, maximizing muscle activation and growth, aligning with the beginner's need for effective exercises. The simple progression makes it ideal for beginners.

exercises.setup_notes: Use a barbell, grip slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
exercises.execution_notes: Lower the bar to the chest, press back up.
exercises.tier_reasons: Great for overload, consistent tension, but long head not fully engaged.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Medial and lateral heads, due to pressing motion.
exercises.selection_reason: This A-Tier exercise complements the Overhead Cable Triceps Extension by targeting the medial and lateral heads of the triceps.  The close grip variation emphasizes triceps activation while allowing for progressive overload, suitable for a beginner's strength building journey. It's a compound movement that efficiently works multiple muscle groups within the time constraint.

exercises.execution_notes: Ensure a deep stretch on the pecs with high tension throughout the range of motion. Maintain a stable position to enhance mind-muscle connection.
exercises.tier_reasons: Provides a deep stretch with high tension, smooth resistance profile, easy to overload, safer to push to failure.
exercises.additional_notes: Find a machine that feels good at your gym for optimal results.
exercises.selection_reason: Selected as an S-Tier chest exercise, the Machine Chest Press offers a smooth resistance profile and a deep stretch, crucial for effective chest development. The machine's stability is beneficial for beginners, ensuring proper form and minimizing the risk of injury.  The ease of progressive overload makes it suitable for long-term progress.

exercises.execution_notes: Perform similar to flat dumbbell press but with an incline.
exercises.tier_reasons: Same benefits as flat dumbbell press with added upper pec emphasis.
exercises.selection_reason: This A-Tier exercise targets the upper pectorals, ensuring balanced chest development. The incline variation provides a different stimulus compared to the flat press, promoting overall muscle growth. Dumbbells allow for a greater range of motion and a deeper stretch, enhancing muscle activation.

exercises.setup_notes: Position the cable at a low setting and use a rope attachment.
exercises.execution_notes: Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead, using a rope.
exercises.tier_reasons: Provides high tension in the stretched position, but rope limits overload potential.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Long head, due to the overhead position providing a deep stretch.
exercises.selection_reason: This A-Tier exercise provides an alternative to the Overhead Cable Triceps Extension with a bar, offering a slightly different feel and focus. The rope attachment allows for a greater range of motion and better mind-muscle connection, particularly beneficial for beginners focusing on form and technique.

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Rotate shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Clasp hands behind your back and gently pull your arms back, stretching your chest. Hold for 15 seconds. Repeat 2 times.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Raise one arm overhead and bend at the elbow, letting your hand fall behind your head. Gently pull your elbow with your other hand. Hold for 15 seconds. Repeat on the other side. Repeat 2 times.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading your legs and raising your arms overhead. Return to starting position. Perform for 1 minute.
